**Meanings**:
- Literal: Clearly manifest, distinctly visible
- Contextual: Unambiguously revealed truth
- Symbolic: Self-evident reality

**Learning Tip**:
- स्फुट emphasizes clarity and distinctness
ब्यक्ताब्यक्त:
# ब्यक्ताब्यक्त
**Transliteration**: vyak-tā-vyak-ta
**POS**: Compound adjective

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्यक्त (vyakta) + अव्यक्त (avyakta) - "manifest" + "unmanifest"
- Morphology: Dual compound covering all existence

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Manifest and unmanifest
- Contextual: All states of cosmic existence
- Symbolic: Totality of being in all forms

**Learning Tip**:
- Fundamental duality in Sankhya philosophy

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Complete spectrum of cosmic manifestation
- **Dharmic Significance**: Unity underlying all dualities
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Sankhya philosophy
ब्यञ्जनं:
# ब्यञ्जनं
**Transliteration**: vyañ-ja-naṁ
**POS**: Noun (accusative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + अञ्ज् (añj) + अन (ana) + अम् (am) - "to manifest" + accusative
- Morphology: That which manifests or reveals

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Consonant, manifestation, ornament
- Contextual: Means of expression or revelation
- Symbolic: Form through which formless appears

**Learning Tip**:
- In grammar: consonants that "color" vowels
ब्यपकत्त्वाद्बिन्दुमुक्तं:
# ब्यपकत्त्वाद्बिन्दुमुक्तं
**Transliteration**: vya-pa-kat-tvād-bin-du-muk-taṁ
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्यापक (vyāpaka) + त्व (tva) + बिन्दु (bindu) + मुक्त (mukta) - "pervasiveness" + "point" + "liberated"
- Morphology: Causal ablative with compound predicate

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Liberated from bindu due to pervasiveness
- Contextual: Freedom from concentration through expansion
- Symbolic: Transcending point-consciousness to infinity

**Learning Tip**:
- Ablative indicates cause of liberation
ब्यवहारोणजानन्तिमित्राणि:
# ब्यवहारोणजानन्तिमित्राणि
**Transliteration**: vya-va-hā-ro-ṇa-jā-nan-ti-mi-trā-ṇi
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्यवहार (vyavahāra) + जानन्ति (jānanti) + मित्र (mitra) + आणि (āṇi)
- Morphology: Complex construction about practical knowledge

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Related to practical dealings and knowing friends
- Contextual: Worldly interactions and relationships
- Symbolic: Conventional reality and social bonds

**Learning Tip**:
- व्यवहार refers to practical, worldly activity
ब्यश्नुते:
# ब्यश्नुते
**Transliteration**: vyaś-nu-te
**POS**: Verb (3rd person singular, middle)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + अश् (aś) + नु (nu) + ते (te) - "to reach/attain" + middle voice
- Morphology: Middle voice indicating self-beneficial attainment

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Attains for oneself, reaches
- Contextual: Spiritual achievement or realization
- Symbolic: Self-fulfilling consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- Middle voice emphasizes personal spiritual benefit
ब्यष्टि:
# ब्यष्टि
**Transliteration**: vya-ṣṭi
**POS**: Noun (feminine)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + अष् (aṣ) + टि (ṭi) - "individual manifestation"
- Morphology: Individual as opposed to collective

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Individual, particular manifestation
- Contextual: Individual consciousness vs. cosmic
- Symbolic: Apparent separation from unity

**Learning Tip**:
- Opposite of समष्टि (collective/cosmic)

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Individual manifestation of universal consciousness
- **Dharmic Significance**: Personal spiritual journey
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Advaita Vedanta
ब्यापकत्वादि:
# ब्यापकत्वादि
**Transliteration**: vyā-pa-kat-vā-di
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्यापक (vyāpaka) + त्व (tva) + आदि (ādi) - "pervasive" + "quality" + "etc."
- Morphology: Qualities beginning with pervasiveness

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Pervasiveness and similar qualities
- Contextual: Qualities of infinite consciousness
- Symbolic: Attributes of absolute reality

**Learning Tip**:
- आदि indicates a series of similar divine qualities
ब्यापिनी:
# ब्यापिनी
**Transliteration**: vyā-pi-nī
**POS**: Adjective (feminine)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + आप् (āp) + इन् (in) + ई (ī) - "pervading" + feminine agent
- Morphology: Feminine form of "that which pervades"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: She who pervades, pervasive feminine energy
- Contextual: Divine feminine consciousness pervading all
- Symbolic: Shakti as all-pervading principle

**Learning Tip**:
- Feminine form emphasizes divine feminine aspect

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine feminine as universal pervasion
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Shakti in cosmic form
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Recognition of divine feminine everywhere
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Shakta literature
ब्याहृति:
# ब्याहृति
**Transliteration**: vyā-hṛ-ti
**POS**: Noun (feminine)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + आ (ā) + हृ (hṛ) + ति (ti) - "special utterance"
- Morphology: Sacred utterance or mystical syllable

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Sacred utterance, mystical statement
- Contextual: Fundamental sounds of creation
- Symbolic: Cosmic vibrations manifesting reality

**Learning Tip**:
- Seven vyahritis: bhūḥ, bhuvaḥ, svaḥ, etc.

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Sound vibrations creating/sustaining cosmos
- **Mantric Significance**: Sacred syllables in Vedic chanting
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Sound-based meditation
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedic literature
ब्याहृतिः:
# ब्याहृतिः
**Transliteration**: vyā-hṛ-tiḥ
**POS**: Noun (nominative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्याहृति (vyāhṛti) + विसर्ग (ḥ) - sacred utterance + nominative
- Morphology: Subject form of sacred utterance

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The sacred utterance, mystical sound
- Contextual: Cosmic creative vibration
- Symbolic: Word as creative principle

**Learning Tip**:
- Nominative form when discussing cosmic sound
ब्युत्पत्यर्थ:
# ब्युत्पत्यर्थ
**Transliteration**: vyut-pat-yar-tha
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: वि (vi) + उत्पत्ति (utpatti) + अर्थ (artha) - "etymological meaning"
- Morphology: Meaning derived from word formation

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Etymological meaning, derivational sense
- Contextual: Deep meaning revealed through analysis
- Symbolic: Truth discovered through investigation

**Learning Tip**:
- Important in Sanskrit grammatical analysis
ब्रजेत्:
# ब्रजेत्
**Transliteration**: vra-jet
**POS**: Verb (3rd person singular, optative)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: व्रज् (vraj) + एत् (et) - "to go/wander" + optative
- Morphology: Optative expressing should/might go

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Should go, might wander
- Contextual: Spiritual journey or pilgrimage
- Symbolic: Movement toward realization

**Learning Tip**:
- व्रज also refers to Krishna's land
ब्रहमाबिष्ण्वीशाः:
# ब्रहमाबिष्ण्वीशाः
**Transliteration**: brah-mā-viṣ-ṇvī-śāḥ
**POS**: Compound noun (nominative plural)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मा (brahmā) + विष्णु (viṣṇu) + ईश (īśa) + आः (āḥ) - Trinity + plural
- Morphology: The three primary deities

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahma, Vishnu, and Ishvara (Shiva)
- Contextual: Hindu trinity representing cosmic functions
- Symbolic: Creation, preservation, and dissolution

**Learning Tip**:
- Fundamental trinity in Hindu cosmology

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Threefold function of divine consciousness
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Trimūrti - cosmic trinity
- **Dharmic Significance**: Complete divine manifestation
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Puranas
ब्रह्म:
# ब्रह्म
**Transliteration**: brah-ma
**POS**: Noun (neuter)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: बृह् (bṛh) + म (ma) - "to expand" + nominal suffix
- Morphology: Absolute reality, ultimate truth

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The absolute, ultimate reality
- Contextual: Formless, attributeless consciousness
- Symbolic: Source and essence of all existence

**Learning Tip**:
- Distinguished from ब्रह्मा (creator deity)

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Ultimate reality underlying all appearance
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Goal of self-realization
- **Dharmic Significance**: Highest truth to be realized
- **Symbolic Representation**: Often represented as ॐ
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads, Vedanta
ब्रह्मएबेदमोङ्कारः:
# ब्रह्मएबेदमोङ्कारः
**Transliteration**: brah-mai-va-ve-da-moṅ-kā-raḥ
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + एव (eva) + वेद (veda) + ॐकार (oṃkāra) - "Brahman indeed Veda-Om"
- Morphology: Identification statement with emphasis

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman indeed is Veda and Omkara
- Contextual: Unity of absolute reality, scripture, and sacred sound
- Symbolic: Complete identity of truth, teaching, and symbol

**Learning Tip**:
- एव emphasizes complete identity

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Unity of reality, revelation, and sound
- **Mantric Significance**: Om as complete expression of Brahman
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads
ब्रह्मचर्यं:
# ब्रह्मचर्यं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-car-yaṁ
**POS**: Noun (accusative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + चर्या (caryā) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + "conduct" + accusative
- Morphology: Conduct oriented toward Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahmacharya, conduct leading to Brahman
- Contextual: Celibate student life stage
- Symbolic: Energy conservation for spiritual growth

**Learning Tip**:
- First ashrama (life stage) in Vedic system

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Preparation for spiritual realization
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Conservation and sublimation of vital energy
- **Dharmic Significance**: Foundation for spiritual development
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Dharma Shastras
ब्रह्मज्ञानोपायः:
# ब्रह्मज्ञानोपायः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-jñā-no-pā-yaḥ
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + ज्ञान (jñāna) + उपाय (upāya) + अः (aḥ) - "Brahman knowledge method"
- Morphology: Means for attaining knowledge of Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Method for Brahman-knowledge
- Contextual: Spiritual practices leading to realization
- Symbolic: Path to ultimate truth

**Learning Tip**:
- उपाय indicates skillful means or method

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Bridge between ignorance and enlightenment
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Systematic spiritual practice
- **Dharmic Significance**: Practical path to liberation
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedanta texts
ब्रह्मणः:
# ब्रह्मणः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-ṇaḥ
**POS**: Noun (genitive singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + अः (aḥ) - "Brahman" + genitive
- Morphology: Possessive or source case of Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of Brahman, from Brahman
- Contextual: Belonging to or originating from ultimate reality
- Symbolic: Divine source or ownership

**Learning Tip**:
- Genitive shows relationship or source
ब्रह्मणश्च:
# ब्रह्मणश्च
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-ṇaś-ca
**POS**: Noun phrase

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + च (ca) - "Brahman" + "and"
- Morphology: Brahman also/and

**Meanings**:
- Literal: And of Brahman, Brahman also
- Contextual: Including Brahman in discussion
- Symbolic: Inclusive reference to ultimate reality

**Learning Tip**:
- च adds emphasis or inclusion
ब्रह्मणि:
# ब्रह्मणि
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-ṇi
**POS**: Noun (locative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + इ (i) - "Brahman" + locative
- Morphology: In Brahman, within ultimate reality

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In Brahman, within ultimate reality
- Contextual: Established in absolute consciousness
- Symbolic: Absorption in the absolute

**Learning Tip**:
- Locative indicates stable position within
ब्रह्मणो:
# ब्रह्मणो
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-ṇo
**POS**: Noun (genitive singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + अः (aḥ) - "Brahman" + genitive (sandhi form)
- Morphology: Of Brahman (sandhi changes ḥ to o)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of Brahman, Brahman's
- Contextual: Belonging to ultimate reality
- Symbolic: Divine possession or source

**Learning Tip**:
- Sandhi form of ब्रह्मणः before consonants
ब्रह्मणोऽभिधानमुदाहृतं:
# ब्रह्मणोऽभिधानमुदाहृतं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-ṇo-'bhi-dhā-na-mu-dā-hṛ-taṁ
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + अभिधान (abhidhāna) + उदाहृत (udāhṛta) - "Brahman" + "designation" + "stated"
- Morphology: Statement about naming Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The designation of Brahman has been stated
- Contextual: Explanation of how ultimate reality is named
- Symbolic: Verbal pointing toward the ineffable

**Learning Tip**:
- अभिधान refers to naming or designation
ब्रह्मत्वं:
# ब्रह्मत्वं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-tvaṁ
**POS**: Noun (accusative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + त्व (tva) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + "quality" + accusative
- Morphology: The quality of being Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman-ness, the state of being Brahman
- Contextual: Ultimate enlightened condition
- Symbolic: Realization of one's true nature

**Learning Tip**:
- त्व suffix creates abstract quality nouns

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Actualized unity with ultimate reality
- **Dharmic Significance**: Highest spiritual achievement
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Advaita Vedanta
ब्रह्मनस्त्रिविधः:
# ब्रह्मनस्त्रिविधः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-nas-tri-vi-dhaḥ
**POS**: Compound adjective

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + त्रि (tri) + विध (vidha) + अः (aḥ) - "Brahman" + "three" + "kinds"
- Morphology: Threefold nature of Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman is threefold
- Contextual: Three aspects of ultimate reality
- Symbolic: Unity expressing through trinity

**Learning Tip**:
- त्रिविध indicates threefold classification
ब्रह्मनिर्भयं:
# ब्रह्मनिर्भयं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-nir-bha-yaṁ
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + निर् (nir) + भय (bhaya) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + "without" + "fear"
- Morphology: Fearlessness in Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Fearlessness in Brahman
- Contextual: Security found in ultimate reality
- Symbolic: Transcendence of all anxiety

**Learning Tip**:
- निर् prefix negates fear completely

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Absolute security in ultimate truth
- **Dharmic Significance**: Freedom from existential anxiety
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads
ब्रह्मन्:
# ब्रह्मन्
**Transliteration**: brah-man
**POS**: Noun (masculine/neuter)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: बृह् (bṛh) + मन् (man) - "to expand" + agent/abstract suffix
- Morphology: Ultimate reality, absolute consciousness

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The absolute, ultimate reality
- Contextual: Formless, infinite consciousness
- Symbolic: Ground of all being

**Learning Tip**:
- Stem form used in compounds

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Ultimate reality beyond all categories
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Object of highest meditation
- **Dharmic Significance**: True self of all beings
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads
ब्रह्मबिन्दुः:
# ब्रह्मबिन्दुः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-bin-duḥ
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + बिन्दु (bindu) + विसर्ग (ḥ) - "Brahman" + "point"
- Morphology: Brahman as concentrated point

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman-point, concentrated absolute
- Contextual: Ultimate reality in concentrated form
- Symbolic: Infinity focused to a point

**Learning Tip**:
- Paradox of infinite concentrated to point

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Source point of all manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on concentrated absolute
- **Symbolic Representation**: Point containing infinity
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Tantric texts
ब्रह्मबिष्णुरुर्द्धबिन्दु:
# ब्रह्मबिष्णुरुर्द्धबिन्दु
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-viṣ-ṇu-rur-ddha-bin-du
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + विष्णु (viṣṇu) + ऊर्ध्व (ūrdhva) + बिन्दु (bindu)
- Morphology: Trinity with ascending point

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahma, Vishnu, and upward point
- Contextual: Creative trinity with transcendent element
- Symbolic: Manifest divinity pointing to unmanifest

**Learning Tip**:
- ऊर्ध्व indicates upward/transcendent direction
ब्रह्मबिष्णुशिबात्मकं:
# ब्रह्मबिष्णुशिबात्मकं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-viṣ-ṇu-śi-vāt-ma-kaṁ
**POS**: Compound adjective

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मा (brahmā) + विष्णु (viṣṇu) + शिव (śiva) + आत्मक (ātmaka) + अम् (am)
- Morphology: Having the nature of the trinity

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Having the nature of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva
- Contextual: Embodying all divine functions
- Symbolic: Complete divine manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- आत्मक suffix means "having the nature of"
ब्रह्मभूयः:
# ब्रह्मभूयः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-bhū-yaḥ
**POS**: Noun (masculine)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + भू (bhū) + य (ya) + अः (aḥ) - "becoming Brahman"
- Morphology: State of becoming Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Becoming Brahman, Brahman-realization
- Contextual: Process of spiritual transformation
- Symbolic: Awakening to true nature

**Learning Tip**:
- भूय indicates becoming or transformation

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Individual consciousness realizing universal nature
- **Dharmic Significance**: Ultimate spiritual achievement
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedanta literature
ब्रह्मभूर्भुबःस्वरोम्:
# ब्रह्मभूर्भुबःस्वरोम्
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-bhūr-bhu-vaḥ-sva-rom
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + भूः (bhūḥ) + भुवः (bhuvaḥ) + स्वः (svaḥ) + ॐ (om)
- Morphology: Brahman with three worlds and Om

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman, earth, atmosphere, heaven, and Om
- Contextual: Complete cosmic reality with sacred sound
- Symbolic: All levels of existence unified in absolute

**Learning Tip**:
- Three vyahritis representing complete cosmos

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Complete cosmic hierarchy under Brahman
- **Mantric Significance**: Sacred formula encompassing all
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedic literature
ब्रह्मयोनिं:
# ब्रह्मयोनिं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-yo-niṁ
**POS**: Compound noun (accusative)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + योनि (yoni) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + "source/womb"
- Morphology: Brahman as source or womb

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman-womb, source in Brahman
- Contextual: Ultimate reality as creative source
- Symbolic: Divine feminine principle of manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- योनि represents source, origin, or creative matrix

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Ultimate reality as creative matrix
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Recognition of divine source
- **Symbolic Representation**: Cosmic womb or yoni
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Tantric and Puranic texts
ब्रह्मरूपस्याक्षरस्योपब्याख्यानं:
# ब्रह्मरूपस्याक्षरस्योपब्याख्यानं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-rū-pa-syāk-ṣa-ra-syo-pa-vyā-khyā-naṁ
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + रूप (rūpa) + अक्षर (akṣara) + उपव्याख्यान (upavyākhyāna)
- Morphology: Explanation of Brahman's imperishable form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Explanation of Brahman's imperishable form
- Contextual: Commentary on eternal aspect of absolute
- Symbolic: Teaching about unchanging reality

**Learning Tip**:
- उपव्याख्यान means detailed explanation or commentary
ब्रह्मलोके:
# ब्रह्मलोके
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-lo-ke
**POS**: Compound noun (locative)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + लोक (loka) + ए (e) - "Brahman" + "world" + locative
- Morphology: In the world of Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In Brahman's world, in the realm of Brahman
- Contextual: Highest spiritual realm or state
- Symbolic: Consciousness established in absolute

**Learning Tip**:
- ब्रह्मलोक is highest of the seven worlds

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Highest realm of cosmic manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Advanced meditative state
- **Dharmic Significance**: Near-liberation state
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Puranas, Upanishads
ब्रह्मसप्राणस्तदबाङ्गनः:
# ब्रह्मसप्राणस्तदबाङ्गनः
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-sa-prā-ṇas-ta-da-vāṅ-ga-naḥ
**POS**: Complex compound

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + स (sa) + प्राण (prāṇa) + तत् (tat) + अव (ava) + अङ्ग (aṅga)
- Morphology: Complex description of Brahman with life-force and limbs

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman with life-force and its subsidiary limbs
- Contextual: Complete description of cosmic person
- Symbolic: Absolute reality with all manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- स indicates "with" or "accompanied by"
ब्रह्मस्वरूपं:
# ब्रह्मस्वरूपं
**Transliteration**: brah-ma-sva-rū-paṁ
**POS**: Compound noun (accusative)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + स्वरूप (svarūpa) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + "own-form"
- Morphology: Brahman's essential nature

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman's own form, essential nature of Brahman
- Contextual: True nature of ultimate reality
- Symbolic: Inherent being of the absolute

**Learning Tip**:
- स्वरूप indicates essential, inherent nature

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Essential nature of ultimate reality
- **Dharmic Significance**: True nature to be realized
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Advaita Vedanta
ब्रह्मा:
# ब्रह्मा
**Transliteration**: brah-mā
**POS**: Noun (masculine, nominative)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: बृह् (bṛh) + मन् (man) + आ (ā) - "expanding consciousness" + deity name
- Morphology: Creator deity in Hindu trinity

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahma, the creator deity
- Contextual: Cosmic function of creation
- Symbolic: Divine creativity and manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- Distinguished from neuter ब्रह्म (absolute reality)

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Creative aspect of divine consciousness
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Four-headed creator deity
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on creative principle
- **Symbolic Representation**: Four-faced, lotus-born deity
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Puranas, Tantras
ब्रह्मांशिकजीबस्य:
# ब्रह्मांशिकजीबस्य
**Transliteration**: brah-māṁ-śi-ka-jī-va-sya
**POS**: Compound noun (genitive)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्म (brahma) + अंश (aṁśa) + जीव (jīva) + स्य (sya) - "Brahman" + "part" + "soul"
- Morphology: Of the soul which is a part of Brahman

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of the individual soul as part of Brahman
- Contextual: Individual consciousness as divine fragment
- Symbolic: Apparent separation that is actually unity

**Learning Tip**:
- अंशिक indicates partial or fragmentary

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Individual manifestation of universal consciousness
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of divine nature of self
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vishishtadvaita Vedanta
ब्रह्माणं:
# ब्रह्माणं
**Transliteration**: brah-mā-ṇaṁ
**POS**: Noun (accusative singular)

**Root Analysis**:
- Root: ब्रह्मन् (brahman) + अम् (am) - "Brahman" + accusative
- Morphology: Brahman as object

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman (as object of knowledge/meditation)
- Contextual: Ultimate reality as goal of seeking
- Symbolic: Absolute as object of spiritual pursuit

**Learning Tip**:
- Accusative form when Brahman is direct object

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Ultimate reality as goal of spiritual practice
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Object of highest meditation
- **Dharmic Significance**: Ultimate attainment in spiritual life
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads, Vedanta texts
ब्रह्माण्डञ्चापिकोटिशः:
# ब्रह्माण्डञ्चापिकोटिशः
**Transliteration**: brah-mā-ṇḍañ-cā-pi-ko-ṭi-śaḥ
**POS**: Compound noun with enclitic particles

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रह्मण्ड (brahmaṇḍa): ब्रह्म (brahman) + अण्ड (aṇḍa, egg/universe)
- च (ca): enclitic "and"
- अपि (api): particle "even/also"
- कोटि (koṭi): "ten million, countless"
- शः suffix indicating multiplicity

**Meanings**:
- Literal: And even countless millions of universes
- Contextual: Reference to infinite cosmic manifestation in Yoga Vasishtha
- Symbolic: The limitless nature of brahman's creative power

**Learning Tip**:
- Remember ब्रह्माण्ड as "cosmic egg" - the universe as brahman's manifestation

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Infinite multiplicity within unified consciousness
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on cosmic vastness
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Virat-purusha, cosmic form
- **Mantric Significance**: Contemplation of Om as cosmic sound
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of brahman's infinite manifestation
- **Symbolic Representation**: Multiple nested spheres in cosmic diagrams
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Puranas, Yoga Vasishtha
ब्रह्माधिगच्छति:
# ब्रह्माधिगच्छति
**Transliteration**: brah-mā-dhi-gac-cha-ti
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular present

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रह्म (brahma): ultimate reality + अधिगम् (adhigam): to attain/realize
- गम् (gam) root with अधि prefix: "to go towards, attain"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: One attains/realizes brahman
- Contextual: The culmination of spiritual practice described in Yoga Vasishtha
- Symbolic: The ultimate goal of consciousness realization

**Learning Tip**:
- अधिगम् means "to go beyond and attain" - transcendent realization

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The moment of ultimate realization
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Samadhi states leading to brahma-jnana
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Pure consciousness without attributes
- **Mantric Significance**: The silence after Om
- **Dharmic Significance**: Liberation from all conditioning
- **Symbolic Representation**: Light emerging from darkness
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads, Advaita texts
ब्रह्मासीत्:
# ब्रह्मासीत्
**Transliteration**: brah-mā-sīt
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular past tense with copula

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रह्म (brahma) + आसीत् (āsīt): was/existed
- आस् (ās) root: "to be, exist"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brahman was/existed
- Contextual: Reference to primordial existence before creation
- Symbolic: The eternal being that precedes all manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- आसीत् indicates past existence, often used in creation narratives

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Primordial consciousness before manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on the uncaused cause
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Nirguna brahman, attributeless absolute
- **Mantric Significance**: The eternal Pranava
- **Dharmic Significance**: Existence beyond time and causation
- **Symbolic Representation**: Void pregnant with potential
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Creation hymns in Vedas
ब्रह्मैबात्मेति:
# ब्रह्मैबात्मेति
**Transliteration**: brah-mai-va-āt-me-ti
**POS**: Compound expression with emphatic particles

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रह्म (brahma) + एव (eva, indeed) + आत्मा (ātmā, self) + इति (iti, thus)
- Emphatic declaration of identity

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "Brahman indeed is the self" - thus
- Contextual: Core teaching of Advaita philosophy in Yoga Vasishtha
- Symbolic: The fundamental unity of individual and universal consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- एव adds emphasis: "indeed, verily"
- इति marks the end of a quotation or teaching

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The great equation of Advaita Vedanta
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Self-inquiry leading to realization
- **Deity or Energy Form**: The unity of Atman-Brahman
- **Mantric Significance**: Mahavakya contemplation
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of non-dual reality
- **Symbolic Representation**: Single light appearing as many reflections
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Upanishads, especially Advaita texts
ब्रह्मैवास्मिन:
# ब्रह्मैवास्मिन
**Transliteration**: brah-mai-vās-min
**POS**: Compound with locative case

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रह्म (brahma) + एव (eva) + अस्मिन् (asmin, locative "in this")
- Locative construction indicating location or context

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In this very brahman
- Contextual: Everything exists within brahman's consciousness
- Symbolic: The all-pervading nature of ultimate reality

**Learning Tip**:
- अस्मिन् is locative singular of इदम् (this)
- एव emphasizes the immediacy and certainty

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Brahman as the substratum of all existence
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Seeing all phenomena within consciousness
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Antaryamin, the inner controller
- **Mantric Significance**: Contemplation of omnipresence
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of brahman as the ground of being
- **Symbolic Representation**: Space containing all objects
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Isavasya Upanishad, Advaita texts
ब्राह्मणश्चैब:
# ब्राह्मणश्चैब
**Transliteration**: brāh-ma-ṇaś-cai-va
**POS**: Compound noun with conjunctive particles

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्राह्मण (brāhmaṇa): one who knows brahman, priest class
- च (ca) + एव (eva): "and indeed"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: And indeed the brahmana (priest/knower of brahman)
- Contextual: Reference to spiritual authority in Vedic society
- Symbolic: One established in brahman-knowledge

**Learning Tip**:
- ब्राह्मण derives from ब्रह्म + suffix, indicating one connected to brahman

**Learning Tip**:
- चैव (caiva) is sandhi of च + एव, meaning "and indeed"
ब्राह्मणे:
# ब्राह्मणे
**Transliteration**: brāh-ma-ṇe
**POS**: Noun, locative or dative case

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्राह्मण (brāhmaṇa) in 7th case (locative) or 4th case (dative)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In/to the brahmana
- Contextual: Reference to spiritual teacher or knower of brahman
- Symbolic: The repository of vedic wisdom and brahman-knowledge

**Learning Tip**:
- Context determines whether locative ("in") or dative ("to") case
ब्रुतेकिमोमित्यादि:
# ब्रुतेकिमोमित्यादि
**Transliteration**: bru-te-ki-mo-mi-ty-ā-di
**POS**: Complex compound with interrogative and demonstrative elements

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रूते (brūte): speaks, says (from ब्रू root)
- किम् (kim): what
- ओम् (om): sacred syllable
- इति (iti): thus
- आदि (ādi): beginning, etc.

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Says "what is Om" and so forth
- Contextual: Beginning of inquiry into the nature of Om
- Symbolic: The questioning that leads to spiritual understanding

**Learning Tip**:
- ब्रूते is middle voice meaning "speaks for oneself"
ब्रुयात्:
# ब्रुयात्
**Transliteration**: bru-yāt
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular optative

**Root Analysis**:
- ब्रू (brū) root meaning "to speak" + optative suffix यात्

**Meanings**:
- Literal: One should say/speak
- Contextual: Prescriptive statement about proper speech
- Symbolic: The importance of truthful spiritual discourse

**Learning Tip**:
- Optative mood expresses what should or may happen
भक्तिश्च:
# भक्तिश्च
**Transliteration**: bhak-tiś-ca
**POS**: Compound noun with conjunctive particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भक्ति (bhakti) from भज् (bhaj, to serve/worship) + ति suffix
- च (ca): and

**Meanings**:
- Literal: And devotion
- Contextual: Devotional practice as spiritual path in Yoga Vasishtha
- Symbolic: Heart-centered approach to the divine

**Learning Tip**:
- भज् root means "to share, partake, worship"

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Devotion as a means of self-transcendence
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Bhakti yoga practices
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Personal deity worship
- **Mantric Significance**: Devotional chanting and prayer
- **Dharmic Significance**: Surrender of ego to higher consciousness
- **Symbolic Representation**: Heart lotus opening to divine light
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Bhagavata Purana, devotional texts
भक्त्ति:
# भक्त्ति
**Transliteration**: bhak-tti
**POS**: Noun, variant spelling

**Root Analysis**:
- भज् (bhaj) + ति suffix, alternative form of भक्ति

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Devotion, worship
- Contextual: Same as भक्ति, devotional practice
- Symbolic: Love-surrender to the divine

**Learning Tip**:
- Alternative spelling showing geminated consonant

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Path of love leading to unity
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Emotional purification through devotion
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Ishta devata worship
- **Mantric Significance**: Nama-japa and devotional mantras
- **Dharmic Significance**: Ego dissolution through divine love
- **Symbolic Representation**: Devotee prostrating before deity
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Devotional literature across traditions
भगो:
# भगो
**Transliteration**: bha-go
**POS**: Noun, nominative singular

**Root Analysis**:
- भग (bhaga): fortune, prosperity, divine glory
- Often referring to divine attributes

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Fortune, prosperity, divine glory
- Contextual: Divine blessing or auspicious quality
- Symbolic: The beneficent aspect of divinity

**Learning Tip**:
- भग relates to भगवत् (bhagavat), possessor of divine qualities

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine grace manifesting as blessing
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Cultivation of divine qualities
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Lakshmi, Bhagavan
- **Mantric Significance**: Invocation of divine blessing
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of divine grace in life
- **Symbolic Representation**: Lotus, conch, discus
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vishnu Purana, Bhagavad Gita
भगोरक्ष:
# भगोरक्ष
**Transliteration**: bha-go-rak-ṣa
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- भग (bhaga): divine glory + रक्ष (rakṣa): protection
- रक्ष् (rakṣ) root: to protect, guard

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Protection of divine glory/fortune
- Contextual: Safeguarding spiritual accomplishments
- Symbolic: Divine protection of devotees

**Learning Tip**:
- रक्ष always relates to protection and preservation
भजामि:
# भजामि
**Transliteration**: bha-jā-mi
**POS**: Verb, 1st person singular present

**Root Analysis**:
- भज् (bhaj) root: to worship, serve + आमि (1st person singular)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: I worship, I serve
- Contextual: Personal declaration of devotion
- Symbolic: Individual surrender to the divine

**Learning Tip**:
- भज् is the root of भक्ति - worship leading to devotion

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Individual soul's approach to the supreme
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Personal devotional practice
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Chosen deity worship
- **Mantric Significance**: First-person devotional mantras
- **Dharmic Significance**: Personal commitment to spiritual path
- **Symbolic Representation**: Devotee with hands joined in prayer
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Devotional hymns, Bhagavad Gita
भजामो:
# भजामो
**Transliteration**: bha-jā-mo
**POS**: Verb, 1st person plural present

**Root Analysis**:
- भज् (bhaj) + आमो (1st person plural ending)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: We worship, we serve
- Contextual: Collective devotional practice
- Symbolic: Community in spiritual pursuit

**Learning Tip**:
- आमो ending indicates "we" - collective action
भद्रं:
# भद्रं
**Transliteration**: bha-draṃ
**POS**: Adjective, neuter nominative/accusative

**Root Analysis**:
- भद्र (bhadra): auspicious, good, blessed
- Neuter form भद्रम्

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Auspicious, good, blessed
- Contextual: Positive spiritual quality or outcome
- Symbolic: Divine grace manifesting as wellbeing

**Learning Tip**:
- भद्र always carries positive, auspicious connotations

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine benevolence in manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Cultivation of positive states
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Mangala deities, Ganesha
- **Mantric Significance**: Auspicious invocations
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of divine goodness
- **Symbolic Representation**: Swastika, lotus, kalasha
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedic hymns, auspicious texts
भबतः:
# भबतः
**Transliteration**: bha-va-taḥ
**POS**: Verb form, genitive or ablative case

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū) root: to be, become + वत् suffix + genitive/ablative

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of/from becoming, of existence
- Contextual: Related to the process of being/becoming
- Symbolic: The nature of phenomenal existence

**Learning Tip**:
- भू root fundamental to concepts of existence and becoming
भबति:
# भबति
**Transliteration**: bha-va-ti
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular present

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū) root: to be, become + present tense ending

**Meanings**:
- Literal: It becomes, it is
- Contextual: Statement of existence or becoming
- Symbolic: The continuous process of manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- भवति is the standard present tense form of भू

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The continuous becoming of phenomena
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Witnessing the process of becoming
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Brahma as creator principle
- **Mantric Significance**: Contemplation of impermanence
- **Dharmic Significance**: Understanding the nature of change
- **Symbolic Representation**: Wheel of time, cycles of creation
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Philosophical texts on becoming
भबतीति:
# भबतीति
**Transliteration**: bha-va-tī-ti
**POS**: Verb with quotative particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भवती (bhavatī): becomes (feminine) + इति (iti): thus

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "It becomes" - thus
- Contextual: Quoted statement about becoming
- Symbolic: Recognition of the process of manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- इति often marks the end of a quotation or thought
भबतीत्येबं:
# भबतीत्येबं
**Transliteration**: bha-va-tī-ty-e-vaṃ
**POS**: Complex compound with emphatic particles

**Root Analysis**:
- भवती + इति + एवम् (evam): thus, in this way

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "It becomes" - thus in this way
- Contextual: Emphatic statement about the process of becoming
- Symbolic: Affirmation of the nature of reality's manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- एवम् emphasizes "in this very way"
भबन्ति:
# भबन्ति
**Transliteration**: bha-van-ti
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person plural present

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū) root + अन्ति (3rd person plural ending)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: They become, they are
- Contextual: Multiple entities coming into being
- Symbolic: The multiplicity arising from unity

**Learning Tip**:
- अन्ति is the standard 3rd person plural ending
भबाय:
# भबाय
**Transliteration**: bha-vā-ya
**POS**: Verb, causal form or dative

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū) root + causal suffix आय or dative case

**Meanings**:
- Literal: To cause to become / for becoming
- Contextual: Causative aspect of existence
- Symbolic: The power that brings things into manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- Causal forms show causing an action to happen
भर्गो:
# भर्गो
**Transliteration**: bhar-go
**POS**: Noun, nominative singular

**Root Analysis**:
- भर्ग (bharga): radiance, luster, divine light
- From भृग् root related to brightness

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Radiance, divine light, luster
- Contextual: The luminous aspect of consciousness
- Symbolic: The self-revealing nature of awareness

**Learning Tip**:
- भर्गः appears in Gayatri mantra as divine radiance

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine light illuminating consciousness
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on inner light
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Savitri, solar deities
- **Mantric Significance**: Central term in Gayatri mantra
- **Dharmic Significance**: Self-luminous nature of awareness
- **Symbolic Representation**: Sun, flame, crystal light
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Gayatri mantra, solar hymns
भवता:
# भवता
**Transliteration**: bha-va-tā
**POS**: Pronoun, instrumental case

**Root Analysis**:
- भवत् (bhavat): you (respectful) + instrumental suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: By you (respectful)
- Contextual: Instrumental case showing agency
- Symbolic: Respectful address acknowledging spiritual authority

**Learning Tip**:
- भवत् is respectful form of "you" in Sanskrit
भविष्यतिबृष्टिरिति:
# भविष्यतिबृष्टिरिति
**Transliteration**: bha-viṣ-ya-ti-vṛṣ-ṭi-ri-ti
**POS**: Complex compound with future verb and quotative

**Root Analysis**:
- भविष्यति (bhaviṣyati): will become/happen + वृष्टि (vṛṣṭi): rain + इति

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "There will be rain" - thus
- Contextual: Prediction or statement about future weather
- Symbolic: Natural cycles and their predictability

**Learning Tip**:
- भविष्यति is future tense of भू root
भविष्यदिति:
# भविष्यदिति
**Transliteration**: bha-viṣ-yad-i-ti
**POS**: Verb with quotative particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भविष्यत् (bhaviṣyat): future participle + इति

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "Will become/happen" - thus
- Contextual: Statement about future occurrence
- Symbolic: The inevitability of manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- भविष्यत् is future active participle
भाबानाम:
# भाबानाम
**Transliteration**: bhā-vā-nām
**POS**: Noun, genitive plural

**Root Analysis**:
- भाव (bhāva): feeling, emotion, existence + genitive plural आनाम्

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of feelings/emotions/states of being
- Contextual: Various mental states and emotions
- Symbolic: The range of experiential states in consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- भाव from भू root indicates states of being/feeling

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The emotional spectrum of consciousness
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Witnessing and transforming emotions
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Rasa deities, emotional aspects of divine
- **Mantric Significance**: Bhava mantras for emotional states
- **Dharmic Significance**: Understanding the nature of mental modifications
- **Symbolic Representation**: Various colored energies around heart chakra
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Natya Shastra, devotional literature
भाषा:
# भाषा
**Transliteration**: bhā-ṣā
**POS**: Noun, feminine nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- भाष् (bhāṣ) root: to speak + आ suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Language, speech
- Contextual: The medium of verbal communication and instruction
- Symbolic: The power of word to reveal and conceal truth

**Learning Tip**:
- भाष् root always relates to speech and language

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Language as creative power (Vak)
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Mantra and sacred speech practices
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Saraswati, goddess of speech
- **Mantric Significance**: The power of sacred sounds
- **Dharmic Significance**: Speech as means of dharmic instruction
- **Symbolic Representation**: Lotus emanating sound waves
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vak suktas in Vedas
भाष्य:
# भाष्य
**Transliteration**: bhā-ṣya
**POS**: Noun, neuter

**Root Analysis**:
- भाष् (bhāṣ) root + य suffix indicating "to be spoken about"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Commentary, explanation, exposition
- Contextual: Interpretive text explaining original scriptures
- Symbolic: The tradition of spiritual interpretation and transmission

**Learning Tip**:
- भाष्य specifically means scholarly commentary on texts
भित्वात्मानमागच्छतीति:
# भित्वात्मानमागच्छतीति
**Transliteration**: bhit-vāt-mā-nam-ā-gac-cha-tī-ti
**POS**: Complex compound with participle and quotative

**Root Analysis**:
- भित्वा (bhitvā): having split/divided + आत्मानम् (ātmānam): self + आगच्छति: comes + इति

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "Having divided the self, it comes" - thus
- Contextual: Description of consciousness appearing to divide itself
- Symbolic: The apparent fragmentation of unitary awareness

**Learning Tip**:
- भित्वा is gerund (absolutive) showing completed action

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The apparent division of consciousness into subject-object
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Understanding the illusion of separation
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Maya-shakti creating apparent duality
- **Mantric Significance**: Recognition of fundamental unity
- **Dharmic Significance**: The cosmic game of hide-and-seek
- **Symbolic Representation**: One light appearing as many reflections
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Advaita texts on consciousness
भिधानं:
# भिधानं
**Transliteration**: bhi-dhā-naṃ
**POS**: Noun, neuter nominative/accusative

**Root Analysis**:
- विधा (vidhā): arrangement, method + न suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Arrangement, method, designation
- Contextual: Systematic presentation or classification
- Symbolic: The ordered structure of spiritual teaching

**Learning Tip**:
- धा root relates to placing, arranging, establishing
भीमाय:
# भीमाय
**Transliteration**: bhī-mā-ya
**POS**: Noun, dative case

**Root Analysis**:
- भीम (bhīma): terrible, formidable + dative suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: To/for the terrible/formidable one
- Contextual: Reference to fierce aspect of divinity or powerful being
- Symbolic: The awesome power that can destroy ignorance

**Learning Tip**:
- भीम often refers to Bhima or fierce deities like Rudra
भुजं:
# भुजं
**Transliteration**: bhu-jaṃ
**POS**: Noun, accusative singular

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज (bhuja): arm, side (geometric) + accusative ending

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Arm, side (of geometric figure)
- Contextual: Mathematical term for side of triangle/rectangle
- Symbolic: The supporting structure of spiritual practice

**Learning Tip**:
- In mathematics, भुज specifically means the horizontal side
भुजंद्विर्बिभक्तं:
# भुजंद्विर्बिभक्तं
**Transliteration**: bhu-jaṃ-dvir-bi-bhak-taṃ
**POS**: Compound mathematical expression

**Root Analysis**:
- भुजम् + द्विः (dvis): twice + बिभक्त (bibhakta): divided

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The side divided twice/by two
- Contextual: Mathematical operation in geometric calculations
- Symbolic: The precision required in spiritual methodology

**Learning Tip**:
- बिभक्त is past participle of भज् in sense of "divide"
भुजकोटिवर्गयोगमूलं:
# भुजकोटिवर्गयोगमूलं
**Transliteration**: bhu-ja-ko-ṭi-var-ga-yo-ga-mū-laṃ
**POS**: Complex mathematical compound

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज (bhuja): base + कोटि (koṭi): perpendicular + वर्ग (varga): square + योग (yoga): sum + मूल (mūla): root

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Square root of sum of squares of base and perpendicular
- Contextual: Pythagorean theorem in Sanskrit mathematical terminology
- Symbolic: The integration of different aspects to find fundamental truth

**Learning Tip**:
- This is the Sanskrit expression for the Pythagorean theorem
भुजक्षेत्रं:
# भुजक्षेत्रं
**Transliteration**: bhu-ja-kṣe-traṃ
**POS**: Compound noun, neuter

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज (bhuja): arm/side + क्षेत्र (kṣetra): field, area

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Area of the arm/side, geometric area
- Contextual: Mathematical concept of area calculation
- Symbolic: The measured space of spiritual practice

**Learning Tip**:
- क्षेत्र in mathematics means area or field
भुजाग्रचिन्हित:
# भुजाग्रचिन्हित
**Transliteration**: bhu-jā-gra-cin-hi-ta
**POS**: Compound adjective

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज (bhuja): arm + अग्र (agra): tip/end + चिह्नित (cihnita): marked

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Marked at the tip of the arm/side
- Contextual: Geometric marking or measurement
- Symbolic: Precise demarcation in spiritual methodology

**Learning Tip**:
- अग्र always refers to the tip, end, or extremity
भुजाग्ररेखा:
# भुजाग्ररेखा
**Transliteration**: bhu-jā-gra-re-khā
**POS**: Compound noun, feminine

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज (bhuja) + अग्र (agra) + रेखा (rekhā): line

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Line at the end of the arm/side
- Contextual: Geometric line in mathematical diagrams
- Symbolic: The boundary lines of spiritual discipline

**Learning Tip**:
- रेखा means any drawn line or mark
भुयात्:
# भुयात्
**Transliteration**: bhu-yāt
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular optative

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū): to be/become + optative suffix यात्

**Meanings**:
- Literal: May it be, let it become
- Contextual: Expression of wish or blessing
- Symbolic: Invoking positive manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- Optative mood expresses wish, blessing, or possibility

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine blessing for manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Sankalpa and positive affirmation
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Blessing aspect of divine grace
- **Mantric Significance**: Benedictory mantras and prayers
- **Dharmic Significance**: Invoking dharmic outcomes
- **Symbolic Representation**: Raised hand in blessing gesture
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Vedic benedictions, prayer literature
भूतं:
# भूतं
**Transliteration**: bhū-taṃ
**POS**: Noun/adjective, neuter nominative/accusative

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū): to be + त (past participle suffix)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: That which has become, element, being
- Contextual: Basic elements of creation or past existence
- Symbolic: The manifested forms arising from consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- भूत can mean past tense, element, or being depending on context

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Basic building blocks of manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Understanding elemental nature
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Pancha-mahabhuta deities
- **Mantric Significance**: Elemental mantras and balancing
- **Dharmic Significance**: Recognition of fundamental constituents
- **Symbolic Representation**: Five geometric forms for elements
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Samkhya texts, Ayurveda
भूतानि:
# भूतानि
**Transliteration**: bhū-tā-ni
**POS**: Noun, neuter plural

**Root Analysis**:
- भूत (bhūta): beings/elements + plural ending अनि

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Beings, elements, creatures
- Contextual: All manifested forms and entities
- Symbolic: The diversity of creation from unified consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- अनि is standard neuter plural ending

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The multiplicity of manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Seeing unity in diversity
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Vishva-rupa, cosmic form
- **Mantric Significance**: Universal prayers encompassing all beings
- **Dharmic Significance**: Compassion toward all creatures
- **Symbolic Representation**: Mandala showing interconnected forms
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Bhagavad Gita, Puranas
भूतेषु:
# भूतेषु
**Transliteration**: bhū-te-ṣu
**POS**: Noun, locative plural

**Root Analysis**:
- भूत (bhūta): beings + locative plural ending एषु

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In beings, among creatures
- Contextual: The divine presence within all entities
- Symbolic: The immanent aspect of consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- एषु is locative plural meaning "in, among"

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine presence pervading all existence
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Recognizing consciousness in all forms
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Antaryamin, inner controller
- **Mantric Significance**: Mantras recognizing universal presence
- **Dharmic Significance**: Equal vision toward all beings
- **Symbolic Representation**: Light emanating from within all forms
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Isha Upanishad, Bhagavad Gita
भूमिवृत्तस्य:
# भूमिवृत्तस्य
**Transliteration**: bhū-mi-vṛt-tas-ya
**POS**: Compound noun, genitive case

**Root Analysis**:
- भूमि (bhūmi): earth + वृत्त (vṛtta): circle + genitive स्य

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of the earth's circle/circumference
- Contextual: Reference to astronomical/geographical measurements
- Symbolic: The cyclical nature of earthly existence

**Learning Tip**:
- वृत्त specifically means circle or spherical form
भूम्यर्द्ध:
# भूम्यर्द्ध
**Transliteration**: bhū-my-ar-ddha
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- भूमि (bhūmi): earth + अर्द्ध (ardha): half

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Half of the earth, hemisphere
- Contextual: Geographical or astronomical reference
- Symbolic: Partial understanding of complete reality

**Learning Tip**:
- अर्द्ध always means half or partial
भूयात्:
# भूयात्
**Transliteration**: bhū-yāt
**POS**: Verb, 3rd person singular optative (repeated)

**Root Analysis**:
- भू (bhū): to be/become + optative यात्

**Meanings**:
- Literal: May it be, let it become
- Contextual: Blessing or wishful expression
- Symbolic: Positive affirmation for manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- This is the same as the earlier भुयात् - optative of भू
भूर्भुबः:
# भूर्भुबः
**Transliteration**: bhūr-bhu-vaḥ
**POS**: Compound noun referring to cosmic planes

**Root Analysis**:
- भूर् (bhūr): earth plane + भुवः (bhuvaḥ): atmospheric plane

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Earth and atmospheric realms
- Contextual: First two of the seven cosmic planes in Vedic cosmology
- Symbolic: Lower levels of consciousness and existence

**Learning Tip**:
- These are the first two vyahritis in Gayatri mantra

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Lower cosmic planes of manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation on cosmic levels
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Deities governing respective planes
- **Mantric Significance**: Part of Gayatri and cosmic invocations
- **Dharmic Significance**: Understanding cosmic hierarchy
- **Symbolic Representation**: Lower levels of cosmic diagrams
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Gayatri mantra, Puranas
भूर्भुवःस्वर्:
# भूर्भुवःस्वर्
**Transliteration**: bhūr-bhu-vaḥ-svar
**POS**: Compound noun - the three vyahritis

**Root Analysis**:
- भूर् (bhūr): earth + भुवः (bhuvaḥ): atmosphere + स्वर् (svar): heaven

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Earth, atmosphere, and heaven realms
- Contextual: The three primary cosmic planes in Vedic thought
- Symbolic: Complete spectrum of manifested existence

**Learning Tip**:
- These are the three fundamental vyahritis in Vedic tradition

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Three primary levels of cosmic manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Meditation ascending through cosmic planes
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Trinity governing the three realms
- **Mantric Significance**: Core of Gayatri mantra recitation
- **Dharmic Significance**: Complete invocation of cosmic order
- **Symbolic Representation**: Three-tiered cosmic mountain or tree
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Gayatri mantra, Vedic literature
भूर्भ्रुवः:
# भूर्भ्रुवः
**Transliteration**: bhūr-bhru-vaḥ
**POS**: Compound noun (variant spelling)

**Root Analysis**:
- भूर् (bhūr): earth + भ्रुवः: variant of भुवः (atmospheric plane)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Earth and atmospheric realms (variant spelling)
- Contextual: Same as भूर्भुवः with alternative spelling
- Symbolic: Lower cosmic planes with phonetic variation

**Learning Tip**:
- This appears to be a variant spelling of भूर्भुवः
भैषज्ये:
# भैषज्ये
**Transliteration**: bhai-ṣa-jye
**POS**: Noun, locative case

**Root Analysis**:
- भैषज्य (bhaiṣajya): medicine, healing + locative ending

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In medicine, regarding healing
- Contextual: Medical or therapeutic context
- Symbolic: Spiritual healing and therapeutic wisdom

**Learning Tip**:
- भैषज्य always relates to medicine and healing

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine healing power in manifestation
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Yoga as therapeutic practice
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Dhanvantari, healing deities
- **Mantric Significance**: Healing mantras and therapeutic chants
- **Dharmic Significance**: Dharma as medicine for spiritual ailments
- **Symbolic Representation**: Medicinal herbs, healing hands
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Ayurvedic texts, healing traditions
भो:
# भो
**Transliteration**: bho
**POS**: Interjection, vocative particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भो (bho): vocative interjection "O!"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: O! (addressing someone)
- Contextual: Respectful or emphatic address
- Symbolic: Call to attention in spiritual discourse

**Learning Tip**:
- भो is used to get attention or address someone respectfully
भोः:
# भोः
**Transliteration**: bhoḥ
**POS**: Interjection with visarga

**Root Analysis**:
- भो + visarga for emphasis or pause

**Meanings**:
- Literal: O! (with emphasis)
- Contextual: Emphatic address or call
- Symbolic: Strong invocation for spiritual attention

**Learning Tip**:
- Visarga adds emphasis or indicates pause
भोक्त्तेति:
# भोक्त्तेति
**Transliteration**: bhok-tte-ti
**POS**: Noun with quotative particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भोक्तृ (bhoktṛ): enjoyer, experiencer + इति

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "The experiencer" - thus
- Contextual: Reference to the conscious entity that experiences
- Symbolic: The witnessing aspect of consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- भोक्तृ from भुज् means the one who experiences/enjoys

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Consciousness as experiencer of phenomena
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Witnessing awareness in meditation
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Purusha as conscious principle
- **Mantric Significance**: Recognition of witness consciousness
- **Dharmic Significance**: Understanding the nature of the experiencer
- **Symbolic Representation**: Eye symbol representing witnessing
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Samkhya philosophy, Gita
भोक्त्तेब:
# भोक्त्तेब
**Transliteration**: bhok-tte-va
**POS**: Noun with emphatic particle

**Root Analysis**:
- भोक्तृ (bhoktṛ) + एव (eva): indeed the experiencer

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Indeed the experiencer
- Contextual: Emphasis on the experiencing aspect of consciousness
- Symbolic: The primacy of consciousness as witness

**Learning Tip**:
- एव adds emphasis "indeed, verily"
भोगः:
# भोगः
**Transliteration**: bho-gaḥ
**POS**: Noun, masculine nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- भुज् (bhuj): to enjoy/experience + घ suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Enjoyment, experience, pleasure
- Contextual: Worldly experiences and sensual pleasures
- Symbolic: The experiential aspect of consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- भोग from भुज् always relates to experience or enjoyment

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The experiential dimension of existence
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Understanding attachment to experiences
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Deities associated with pleasure and experience
- **Mantric Significance**: Mantras for proper enjoyment and detachment
- **Dharmic Significance**: Right relationship with worldly pleasures
- **Symbolic Representation**: Various objects of sensual experience
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Kama literature, dharmic texts
भोगाशा:
# भोगाशा
**Transliteration**: bho-gā-śā
**POS**: Compound noun, feminine

**Root Analysis**:
- भोग (bhoga): enjoyment + आशा (āśā): hope, expectation

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Hope/expectation for enjoyment
- Contextual: Desire for sensual or worldly pleasures
- Symbolic: The binding aspect of experiential attachment

**Learning Tip**:
- आशा always indicates hope, expectation, or desire
भ्रमता:
# भ्रमता
**Transliteration**: bhra-ma-tā
**POS**: Verb, present participle instrumental

**Root Analysis**:
- भ्रम् (bhram): to wander, err + present participle

**Meanings**:
- Literal: By wandering, through error
- Contextual: Through confusion or mistaken understanding
- Symbolic: The wandering of mind in ignorance

**Learning Tip**:
- भ्रम् root always relates to wandering, confusion, or error

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: The apparent wandering of consciousness in maya
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Recognizing and correcting mental wandering
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Maya-shakti creating confusion
- **Mantric Significance**: Mantras for clarity and right understanding
- **Dharmic Significance**: Understanding the nature of spiritual confusion
- **Symbolic Representation**: Maze or labyrinth representing confusion
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Texts on maya and spiritual delusion
भ्रातर्द्विरेफ:
# भ्रातर्द्विरेफ
**Transliteration**: bhrā-tar-dvi-re-pha
**POS**: Compound technical term

**Root Analysis**:
- भ्रातृ (bhrātṛ): brother + द्वि (dvi): two + रेफ (repha): the letter 'r'

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Brother with double 'r' sound
- Contextual: Technical grammatical or phonetic reference
- Symbolic: Linguistic precision in sacred sound

**Learning Tip**:
- रेफ specifically refers to the letter/sound 'r' in Sanskrit grammar
म:
# म
**Transliteration**: ma
**POS**: Letter, pronoun, or particle

**Root Analysis**:
- म् (m): the consonant 'म' or pronoun stem

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The letter 'm', or "me" (pronoun stem)
- Contextual: Reference to phonetic or grammatical element
- Symbolic: The closing sound in many mantras (like AUM)

**Learning Tip**:
- म् can be letter, pronoun stem, or part of compounds

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Closing sound representing integration
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Final resonance in mantra practice
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Completion aspect of sacred sound
- **Mantric Significance**: Final sound in AUM and many mantras
- **Dharmic Significance**: Symbol of wholeness and completion
- **Symbolic Representation**: Closed lips in meditation
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Phonetic treatises, Tantra
मकारउच्यते:
# मकारउच्यते
**Transliteration**: ma-kā-rauc-ya-te

**Root Analysis**:
- मकार (makāra): letter 'म' + उच्यते (ucyate): is said/called

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The letter 'म' is said/called
- Contextual: Reference to phonetic or mantric instruction
- Symbolic: Teaching about the significance of sacred sounds

**Learning Tip**:
- उच्यते is passive voice "is said" from वच् root
मकारञ्च:
# मकारञ्च
**Transliteration**: ma-kā-rañ-ca
**POS**: Compound with conjunctive particle

**Root Analysis**:
- मकार (makāra): letter 'म' + च (ca): and

**Meanings**:
- Literal: And the letter 'म'
- Contextual: Including the 'm' sound in phonetic discussion
- Symbolic: The comprehensive nature of sound instruction

- ञ्च is sandhi form of न् + च before certain sounds
मङ्गलार्थ:
# मङ्गलार्थ
**Transliteration**: maṅ-ga-lār-tha
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- मङ्गल (maṅgala): auspicious + अर्थ (artha): purpose, meaning

**Meanings**:
- Literal: For auspicious purpose
- Contextual: Done for blessing or positive outcome
- Symbolic: The intention behind spiritual practices

**Learning Tip**:
- मङ्गल always relates to auspiciousness and well-being

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Divine intention for universal wellbeing
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Setting positive intention in practice
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Ganesha, Mangala deities
- **Mantric Significance**: Auspicious invocations and blessings
- **Dharmic Significance**: Acting for universal good
- **Symbolic Representation**: Swastika, lotus, kalasha
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Ritual texts, prayer literature
मङ्गलेशुभे:
# मङ्गलेशुभे
**Transliteration**: maṅ-ga-le-śu-bhe
**POS**: Compound adjective, locative

**Root Analysis**:
- मङ्गल (maṅgala): auspicious + शुभ (śubha): good, beneficial

**Meanings**:
- Literal: In the auspicious and beneficial
- Contextual: In auspicious and good circumstances
- Symbolic: The beneficial aspect of divine manifestation

- Both मङ्गल and शुभ convey positive, beneficial qualities
मण्डल:
# मण्डल
**Transliteration**: maṇ-ḍa-la
**POS**: Noun, neuter

**Root Analysis**:
- मण्ड् (maṇḍ): to adorn, decorate + ल suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Circle, sphere, region
- Contextual: Sacred geometric form or administrative region
- Symbolic: Completeness and cosmic order

**Learning Tip**:
- मण्डल implies circular, complete, or perfected form

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Sacred geometry reflecting cosmic order
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Mandala meditation for integration
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Various deities in mandala arrangements
- **Mantric Significance**: Geometric support for mantra practice
- **Dharmic Significance**: Symbol of dharmic completeness
- **Symbolic Representation**: Circular sacred diagrams
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: Tantric texts, architectural treatises
मण्डलं:
# मण्डलं
**Transliteration**: maṇ-ḍa-laṃ
**POS**: Noun, neuter accusative/nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- मण्डल (maṇḍala) with anusvara ending

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Circle, mandala (as object)
- Contextual: Sacred circular form used in worship or meditation
- Symbolic: The perfect completeness of spiritual realization

**Learning Tip**:
- Same as मण्डल but in accusative case as direct object
मण्डू:
# मण्डू
**Transliteration**: maṇ-ḍū
**POS**: Noun, unusual form

**Root Analysis**:
- Possibly related to मण्ड् (maṇḍ) or variant form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Unclear - possibly related to decoration or circular form
- Contextual: Requires more context for precise meaning
- Symbolic: May relate to completeness or ornamentation

**Learning Tip**:
- This appears to be an unusual or archaic form
मतं:
# मतं
**Transliteration**: ma-taṃ
**POS**: Adjective/noun, neuter nominative/accusative

**Root Analysis**:
- मन् (man): to think + त (past participle suffix)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Thought, opinion, considered
- Contextual: What is considered or held as opinion
- Symbolic: The content of mental activity

**Learning Tip**:
- मत always relates to thinking, opinion, or mental content
मत्:
# मत्
**Transliteration**: mat
**POS**: Pronoun, 1st person genitive/ablative

**Root Analysis**:
- अहम् (aham): I, in oblique case form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of me, from me, my
- Contextual: First person possessive or ablative
- Symbolic: The ego-sense or personal identity

**Learning Tip**:
- मत् is oblique form of अहम् (I)
मदः:
# मदः
**Transliteration**: ma-daḥ
**POS**: Noun, masculine nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- मद् (mad): to be intoxicated, rejoice + अ suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Intoxication, joy, pride
- Contextual: State of elation or ego-inflation
- Symbolic: Both divine ecstasy and ego-intoxication
