- Symbolic: From the principle of causation

**Learning Tip**:
- त्वात् indicates "because of being"
हो:
# हो
**Transliteration**: ho
**POS**: Interjection/exclamation

**Root Analysis**:
- Simple exclamatory sound

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Oh! Ho!
- Contextual: Exclamation of surprise or calling
- Symbolic: Expression of recognition

**Learning Tip**:
- Common interjection in Sanskrit and Hindi
ह्यादिर्मध्यमान्तस्तथैबच:
# ह्यादिर्मध्यमान्तस्तथैबच
**Transliteration**: hy-ā-dir-ma-dhya-mān-tas-ta-thai-va-ca
**POS**: Complex compound statement

**Root Analysis**:
- हि (hi) + आदि (ādi) "beginning" + मध्यम (madhyama) "middle" + अन्त (anta) "end" + तथैव (tathaiva) "just so" + च (ca) "and"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Indeed beginning, middle, end, just so and
- Contextual: All phases of existence equally
- Symbolic: Omnipresent consciousness

**Learning Tip**:
- Describes the three phases of manifestation
ह्याह:
# ह्याह
**Transliteration**: hy-ā-ha
**POS**: Compound verbal form

**Root Analysis**:
- हि (hi) + आह (āha) "said"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Indeed said
- Contextual: Certainly stated
- Symbolic: Authoritative declaration

**Learning Tip**:
- आह is past tense of √अह् "to say"
ह्यैतत्:
# ह्यैतत्
**Transliteration**: hy-ai-tat
**POS**: Emphatic demonstrative

**Root Analysis**:
- हि (hi) + एतत् (etat) "this"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Indeed this
- Contextual: Certainly this
- Symbolic: Absolute identification

**Learning Tip**:
- एतत् is neuter form of "this"
ह्रस्व:
# ह्रस्व
**Transliteration**: hras-va
**POS**: Adjective

**Root Analysis**:
- From √ह्रस् (hras) "to be short" + suffix -va

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Short (vowel)
- Contextual: Brief in duration
- Symbolic: Minimal manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- Technical term for short vowels in Sanskrit grammar
ॐ:
# ॐ
**Transliteration**: oṃ
**POS**: Sacred syllable

**Root Analysis**:
- Composed of A + U + M + nasalization

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Sacred sound OM
- Contextual: Primordial vibration
- Symbolic: Complete cosmic sound

**Learning Tip**:
- Most sacred sound in Hindu tradition

**Metaphysics**:
- **Cosmic Role**: Primordial cosmic vibration
- **Energetic/Yogic Application**: Universal mantra
- **Deity or Energy Form**: Sound-Brahman
- **Mantric Significance**: Pranava mantra
- **Dharmic Significance**: Sound of creation
- **Symbolic Representation**: Sacred symbol ॐ
- **Primary Textual Attestation**: All Vedic texts
ॐकार:
# ॐकार
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-ra
**POS**: Masculine noun

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + कार (kāra) "making/sound"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The making of OM sound
- Contextual: OM syllable pronunciation
- Symbolic: Cosmic sound manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- कार indicates the act of sound production
ॐकारः:
# ॐकारः
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-raḥ
**POS**: Masculine noun, nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + nominative -ḥ

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The OM sound
- Contextual: Sacred syllable OM
- Symbolic: Cosmic vibration principle

**Learning Tip**:
- Nominative case as subject
ॐकारपूर्ब्बमुद्धृत्य:
# ॐकारपूर्ब्बमुद्धृत्य
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-ra-pūr-va-mud-dhṛ-tya
**POS**: Compound with gerund

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + पूर्व (pūrva) "before" + उद्धृत्य (uddhṛtya) gerund "having extracted"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Having extracted before OM
- Contextual: Having drawn out prior to OM utterance
- Symbolic: Preparatory consciousness extraction

**Learning Tip**:
- Gerund -त्य shows prior action
ॐकारबृत्तमध्यं:
# ॐकारबृत्तमध्यं
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-ra-vṛt-ta-ma-dhyaṃ
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + वृत्त (vṛtta) "circle" + मध्य (madhya) "middle"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Middle of the OM circle
- Contextual: Center of OM meditation
- Symbolic: Core of cosmic vibration

**Learning Tip**:
- वृत्त indicates circular or cyclical patterns
ॐकारवृत्तपादाः:
# ॐकारवृत्तपादाः
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-ra-vṛt-ta-pā-dāḥ
**POS**: Compound noun, nominative plural

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + वृत्त (vṛtta) + पाद (pāda) "quarter/foot"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: The quarters/parts of the OM circle
- Contextual: Divisions of OM meditation
- Symbolic: Components of cosmic sound

**Learning Tip**:
- पाद can mean "quarter" or "foot" depending on context
ॐकारानुज्ञापणात्:
# ॐकारानुज्ञापणात्
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-rā-nu-jñā-pa-ṇāt
**POS**: Ablative of compound

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + अनुज्ञा (anujñā) "permission" + ablative -āt

**Meanings**:
- Literal: From the permission of OM
- Contextual: By authority of OM sound
- Symbolic: Through cosmic sound authorization

**Learning Tip**:
- अनुज्ञा means "permission" or "authorization"
ॐकारेण:
# ॐकारेण
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-re-ṇa
**POS**: Instrumental singular

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + instrumental -eṇa

**Meanings**:
- Literal: By means of OM
- Contextual: Through OM sound
- Symbolic: Via cosmic vibration

**Learning Tip**:
- Instrumental case shows means or method
ॐकारो:
# ॐकारो
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-ro
**POS**: Masculine noun, nominative

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + nominative -o (sandhi form)

**Meanings**:
- Literal: OM sound
- Contextual: Sacred syllable OM
- Symbolic: Primordial vibration

**Learning Tip**:
- Sandhi changes final -ḥ to -o before certain sounds
ॐकारोच्चारणाद्धोमात्:
# ॐकारोच्चारणाद्धोमात्
**Transliteration**: oṃ-kā-roc-cā-ra-ṇād-dho-māt
**POS**: Complex compound with ablative

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐकार (oṃkāra) + उच्चारण (uccāraṇa) "pronunciation" + होम (homa) "fire offering" + ablative

**Meanings**:
- Literal: From pronunciation of OM and fire offering
- Contextual: Through OM recitation and ritual
- Symbolic: Via sound and fire practices

**Learning Tip**:
- उच्चारण means "pronunciation" or "utterance"
ॐज्योतिश्च:
# ॐज्योतिश्च
**Transliteration**: oṃ-jyo-tiś-ca
**POS**: Compound with conjunction

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + ज्योतिस् (jyotis) "light" + च (ca) "and"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: OM and light
- Contextual: Sacred sound and divine light
- Symbolic: Sound-light unity

**Learning Tip**:
- ज्योतिस् is a common term for divine light
ॐन्नमः:
# ॐन्नमः
**Transliteration**: oṃ-na-maḥ
**POS**: Compound mantra

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + नमस् (namas) "salutation"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: OM salutations
- Contextual: Sacred greeting formula
- Symbolic: Reverential offering

**Learning Tip**:
- नमस् forms the basis of "namaste"
ॐबृत्तं:
# ॐबृत्तं
**Transliteration**: oṃ-vṛt-taṃ
**POS**: Compound noun, neuter

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + वृत्त (vṛtta) "circle/happening"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: OM circle/occurrence
- Contextual: OM meditation practice
- Symbolic: Cosmic sound cycle

**Learning Tip**:
- वृत्त can mean both "circle" and "occurred"
ॐमित्येवमग्रमासीत्:
# ॐमित्येवमग्रमासीत्
**Transliteration**: oṃ-mi-ty-e-va-mag-ra-mā-sīt
**POS**: Complex compound sentence

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + इति (iti) + एवम् (evam) "thus" + अग्र (agra) "beginning" + आसीत् (āsīt) "was"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: "OM" - thus indeed was the beginning
- Contextual: OM was the primordial sound
- Symbolic: Cosmic creation through sound

**Learning Tip**:
- आसीत् is past tense of √अस् "to be"
ॐमुड़ुपः:
# ॐमुड़ुपः
**Transliteration**: oṃ-mu-ṇḍu-paḥ
**POS**: Compound noun

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + मुण्ड (muṇḍa) "shaved/head" + उप (upa) prefix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: OM-head/shaved one
- Contextual: OM-focused ascetic
- Symbolic: Renunciant devoted to OM

**Learning Tip**:
- मुण्ड refers to shaved head of renunciants
ॐवृत्तपरिधेःपरं:
# ॐवृत्तपरिधेःपरं
**Transliteration**: oṃ-vṛt-ta-pa-ri-dheḥ-pa-raṃ
**POS**: Compound with comparative

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + वृत्त (vṛtta) "circle" + परिधि (paridhi) "circumference" + पर (para) "beyond"

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Beyond the circumference of OM circle
- Contextual: Transcending OM meditation boundaries
- Symbolic: Beyond cosmic sound limits

**Learning Tip**:
- परिधि means "circumference" or "boundary"
ॐवृत्तस्य:
# ॐवृत्तस्य
**Transliteration**: oṃ-vṛt-tas-ya
**POS**: Genitive of compound

**Root Analysis**:
- ॐ (oṃ) + वृत्त (vṛtta) "circle/occurrence" + genitive -sya

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Of the OM circle/practice
- Contextual: Belonging to OM meditation
- Symbolic: Related to cosmic sound cycle

**Learning Tip**:
- Genitive case shows possession or relationship
।:
# ।
**Transliteration**: (punctuation)
**POS**: Punctuation mark

**Root Analysis**:
- Sanskrit punctuation equivalent to period/full stop

**Meanings**:
- Literal: End of sentence
- Contextual: Completion marker
- Symbolic: Pause in cosmic rhythm

**Learning Tip**:
- Single daṇḍa marks sentence end
।त्रं:
# ।त्रं
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + syllable)
**POS**: Punctuation with suffix

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + त्र (tra) suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: End with instrumental suffix
- Contextual: Completion with means
- Symbolic: Terminated method

**Learning Tip**:
- Unusual combination of punctuation and suffix
।य:
# ।य
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + syllable)
**POS**: Punctuation with suffix

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + य (ya) suffix

**Meanings**:
- Literal: End with relative/abstract suffix
- Contextual: Completion marker with qualifier
- Symbolic: Finished quality

**Learning Tip**:
- य often forms abstract or relative terms
।१:
# ।१
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + एक (eka) "one" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period one
- Contextual: First section marker
- Symbolic: Unity point

**Learning Tip**:
- Devanagari numeral for 1
।११:
# ।११
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + एकादश (ekādaśa) "eleven" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period eleven
- Contextual: Eleventh section marker
- Symbolic: Transcendence number

**Learning Tip**:
- Eleven often symbolizes transcendence of the decimal system
।२:
# ।२
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + द्वि (dvi) "two" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period two
- Contextual: Second section marker
- Symbolic: Duality point

**Learning Tip**:
- Devanagari numeral for 2
।२२:
# ।२२
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + द्वाविंशति (dvāviṃśati) "twenty-two" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period twenty-two
- Contextual: Twenty-second section marker
- Symbolic: Complete alphabet number

**Learning Tip**:
- Twenty-two represents completion in some systems
।२५:
# ।२५
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + पञ्चविंशति (pañcaviṃśati) "twenty-five" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period twenty-five
- Contextual: Twenty-fifth section marker
- Symbolic: Sankhya tattva number

**Learning Tip**:
- Twenty-five tattvas in Sankhya philosophy
।३५:
# ।३५
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + पञ्चत्रिंशत् (pañcatriṃśat) "thirty-five" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period thirty-five
- Contextual: Thirty-fifth section marker
- Symbolic: Expanded tattva system

**Learning Tip**:
- Some systems enumerate more than 25 tattvas
।५:
# ।५
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + पञ्च (pañca) "five" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period five
- Contextual: Fifth section marker
- Symbolic: Fivefold manifestation

**Learning Tip**:
- Five is significant in many spiritual contexts
।६:
# ।६
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + षष् (ṣaṣ) "six" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period six
- Contextual: Sixth section marker
- Symbolic: Sixfold principle

**Learning Tip**:
- Six chakras, six philosophies, etc.
।७:
# ।७
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + सप्त (sapta) "seven" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period seven
- Contextual: Seventh section marker
- Symbolic: Sevenfold cosmic principle

**Learning Tip**:
- Seven is sacred in many traditions
।८१:
# ।८१
**Transliteration**: (punctuation + number)
**POS**: Punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Daṇḍa + एकाशीति (ekāśīti) "eighty-one" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Period eighty-one
- Contextual: Eighty-first section marker
- Symbolic: 9×9 perfection number

**Learning Tip**:
- 81 = 9² represents perfection in some systems
॥:
# ॥
**Transliteration**: (double punctuation)
**POS**: Double punctuation mark

**Root Analysis**:
- Double daṇḍa marking major section end

**Meanings**:
- Literal: End of major section
- Contextual: Chapter or verse completion
- Symbolic: Complete cycle closure

**Learning Tip**:
- Double daṇḍa marks major textual divisions
॥१८:
# ॥१८
**Transliteration**: (double punctuation + number)
**POS**: Double punctuation with numeral

**Root Analysis**:
- Double daṇḍa + अष्टादश (aṣṭādaśa) "eighteen" in numeral form

**Meanings**:
- Literal: Double period eighteen
- Contextual: Eighteenth major section
- Symbolic: Complete scripture number

**Learning Tip**:
- Eighteen is the number of Puranas and Bhagavad Gita chapters
